headline.main: NUTRITION PARLEY: NO LACK OF FOOD

docs.lead_paragraph: Twelve thousand dietitians and nutritionists from institutions across the country are here this week to attend the American Dietetic Association convention. But the look is as much market bazaar as nutrition science assembly, with participants wandering among 113 seminars and demonstrations and 691 booths at which they can sample the latest in low-calorie lasagna, high-fiber cereals and artificially sweetened soft drinks. There are displays of kitchenware, posters showing food groups and charts depicting the chemical breakdown of proteins. One stall is showing off what it calls ''cost-efficient, color- coded hospital food service menu kit systems,'' while another has frozen seafood fillets described as ''skinless and boneless, with no additives or preservatives.''
